alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 4:01PM CST until February 18 at 5:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... La Crosse County in west central Wisconsin... Southern Jackson County in west central Wisconsin... Northwestern Juneau County in central Wisconsin... Monroe County in west central Wisconsin... Southeastern Trempealeau County in west central Wisconsin... * Until 500 PM CST. * At 400 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Pittsville to near Dakota, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 121 and 147. Interstate 90/94 near mile marker 46. Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 1 and 45. Locations impacted include... La Crosse, Sparta, Tomah, Onalaska, Holmen, West Salem, Trempealeau, Bangor, North Bend, Dakota, Millston, Brice Prairie, Fort Mc Coy, French Island, Cataract, Medary, Leon, Portland and Burns. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Trempealeau
